explanation:
Not correct. MISRA C:2023 Rule 21.17 forbids uses of <string.h> functions that can read beyond the bounds of the objects passed. The use of strlen(url) would be a violation only if url could be NULL or point to a non-terminated buffer. In this context the ahc_echo callback is the libmicrohttpd request handler whose API supplies url as a pointer to a NUL-terminated URI string (the callback prototype uses const char *url and the library presents a NUL-terminated URL). Given that API contract, strlen(url) cannot read out of bounds and therefore does not violate 21.17.

If you do not trust the external API contract (or static analysis requires it), a defensive check (e.g. assert(url != NULL) or explicit if (url == NULL) return MHD_NO;) or an annotation documenting the precondition will remove any doubt and satisfy MISRA/static-analysis tools. But as written, assuming the documented libmicrohttpd guarantee, the agent A report is not correct.
